New Records: The Dodgers used eight different pitchers in the game, a franchise record.
Will Smith became the Dodgers' catcher with the most postseason home runs (7).
Key Match Events: Mookie Betts homered twice, including back-to-back games, breaking out of a postseason slump.
Will Smith hit a two-run homer in the third inning.
Gavin Lux hit a two-run homer in the second inning.
Tommy Edman executed a rare safety squeeze bunt for an insurance run.
Shohei Ohtani was thrown out on a bunt by Manny Machado, preventing a potential sixth run.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were without key players like Freddie Freeman and Miguel Rojas but still managed a strong performance.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts emphasized the team's 'fight or flight' mentality.
Padres starter Dylan Cease struggled, allowing four hits and three earned runs in 1 â…” innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Mookie Betts expressed confidence in the team's ability to win the series.
Will Smith reflected on the team's resilience.
Manager Dave Roberts highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in the Dodgers' playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a sellout at Petco Park with a large crowd.
The Dodgers' lineup included eight different players in the first three innings.
The Dodgers' $1 billion investment in free agents like Shohei Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto was noted.
